quest.name: A Breath of Respite
journal: Chai-Nuzz is looking not a little anxious.

dialogue.name: DULIACHAI
dialogue.text: Oh, Forename, my dear. I regret to say that all this moving about has begun to take its toll. Yet my darling husband soldiers on like the redoubtable soul he is.

dialogue.name: DULIACHAI
dialogue.text: I am entirely unqualified to help him with the Talos, of course, but I do what I can to make him more comfortable. A cup of water here, a massage there...

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Gah, there's no point worrying about such things now. I'll get back to my calculations. You, meanwhile, should go and rest as your friends suggested.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: My wife and the Exarch should be in the tavern. Why don't you join them?

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text:
Oh, and Forename? Ahem...
Thank you.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Why are you still here? Go and get some rest while you can!

dialogue.name: DULIACHAI
dialogue.text: ...The Exarch? He went outside a moment ago, my dear. I would've thought you'd have seen him.

dialogue.name: DULIACHAI
dialogue.text: He kept me company for a short while, but then he came over rather pale. He's clearly been straining himself, the poor thing.

dialogue.name: DULIACHAI
dialogue.text: Anyway, he excused himself, saying that he needed a breath of fresh air. Weak as he looked, I did offer to go with him, but he assured me he would be fine. I do hope he's all right...

dialogue.name: DULIACHAI
dialogue.text: Did you find the Exarch? I don't imagine he could have gone far...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The Exarch does not appear to be nearby.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The Exarch does not appear to be anywhere in the vicinity. There is only the shoebill, gazing unflinchingly southward.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: There you are! Ahhh, what a relief... When Dulia told me that the Exarch had disappeared, and that you had been a long time finding him, I had feared the worst had happened right before the moment of truth!

dialogue.name: DULIACHAI
dialogue.text: The Exarch is back, thank heavens, and it seems the sea breeze did him a world of good! I do hope you managed to get a spot of rest as well!

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Worry not, my friend. I am much revived for the fresh air─and your fine company, of course. Now then, let us turn our thoughts back to the task at hand.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, in the imperial palace in the Source...

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Zenos-)Your Radiance. I have taken the liberty of quashing the vile rumors that your heir is possessed by a devil.

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Zenos-)With the nation in the grip of war, we may rely on patriotic zeal to prevent them from resurfacing.

dialogue.name: VARIS
dialogue.text: And what of Emet-Selch?

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Zenos-)He has taken himself to the First, to usher that world to its end.

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Zenos-)Or so I believe. He did not disclose the details of his mission, having ever preferred to work alone.

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Zenos-)Even to those who have known him since the beginning, his actions can prove...unpredictable.

dialogue.name: VARIS
dialogue.text: I am no stranger to his ways. He joys in playing me for a fool. Full many times have I been convinced I was acting of my own volition, only to discover all was as he willed it.

dialogue.name: VARIS
dialogue.text: My dear grandfather...

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Zenos-)On the subject of our esteemed colleague: his last report, though brief, did contain one item of interest.

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Zenos-)You have doubtless wondered why the Scions of the Seventh Dawn have not taken the field of late.

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Zenos-)It is because they are no longer in the Source.

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Zenos-)The hero of the Scions has journeyed to the First─as have herhis comrades, albeit incompletely. Their bodies yet remain here in the Source.

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Zenos-)This presents an opportunity. If we can defeat the Alliance prior to the Scions' return, we may eliminate their order at a stroke.

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Zenos-)And with the Scions gone, none shall remain to thwart our plans. It will be but a matter of striking down the hero upon herhis homecoming.

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Zenos-)Which, lest you forget, is essential to the realization of our objective. Of both of our objectives.

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Zenos-)Through Hydaelyn's meddling, Her champions threaten to wrest the reins of fate from our grasp. The world is at risk of being dragged down the false path.

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Zenos-)One which will never see man reclaim his true form.

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Zenos-)'Tis unthinkable that he should supplant us, incomplete as he is. Such a devolution is abhorrent. And it must be stopped─before it is too late.

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Zenos-)The hour is come, Your Radiance. Order your armies to march once more. Crush all who stand in your way.

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Zenos-)This is your heart's desire, is it not? To seize a victory that is yours and yours alone─for the future of Garlemald!

dialogue.name: ZENOS
dialogue.text: (-???-)Oh dear... You do not wear the mummer's motley well. I was never one to take an interest in tedious conflicts.

dialogue.name: ZENOS
dialogue.text: The whereabouts of my one true friend, however─they interest me greatly. I but hope the beasts of this “First” are providing herhim proper sport.

dialogue.name: ZENOS
dialogue.text: I would know every detail, Lord Zenos. Or would you rather I called you Elidibus?

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Elidibus-)...Hm. Unexpected. Most unexpected.

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Elidibus-)That immortality should be within the reach of one with a borrowed Echo.

dialogue.name: ROBEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Elidibus-)You have outdone yourself, Zenos yae Galvus.

dialogue.name: ZENOS
dialogue.text: I have no particular attachment to that name─but I am rather fond of that body. Without it, I cannot enjoy my hunt to the fullest.

dialogue.name: ZENOS
dialogue.text: Your secrets or my flesh. I care not which you give me first. The choice is yours.
